class AllDataParser[source]

AllDataParser(data_dir) :: Parser

Read all image files from data_dir, used with IceVision models

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Object detection and instance segmentation test-time augmentation is slighly more difficult than classification or segmentation. Use process described here: https://www.kaggle.com/c/data-science-bowl-2018/discussion/56326

  • Use horizontal and vertical flip as augmentations
  • Combine predictions and run bbox NMS with threshold of 0.1 to get rid of overlapping false positives
{% raw %}

icevision_tta[source]

icevision_tta(model_type, items, model)

Simple TTA with horizontal and vertical flips as augmentations

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

predict_bboxes_icevision[source]

predict_bboxes_icevision(path_to_model_config:"Path to pretrained model folder", path_to_image:"Path to image to annotate", outfile:"Path and filename for output raster", processing_dir:"Directory to save the intermediate tiles. Deleted after use", tile_size:"Tile size to use. Default 400x400px tiles", tile_overlap:"Tile overlap to use. Default 100px", num_classes:"Number of classes to predict. Default 2", use_tta:"Use test-time augmentation")

Detect bounding boxes from a new image using a pretrained model

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

predict_instance_masks_icevision[source]

predict_instance_masks_icevision(path_to_model_config:"Path to pretrained model folder", path_to_image:"Path to image to annotate", outfile:"Path and filename for output raster", processing_dir:"Directory to save the intermediate tiles. Deleted after use", tile_size:"Tile size to use. Default 400x400px tiles", tile_overlap:"Tile overlap to use. Default 100px", use_tta:"Use test-time augmentation", smooth_preds:"Run fill_holes and dilate_erode to masks")

Segment instance masks from a new image using a pretrained model

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
